results.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
results.creator_credit: UGC Images, Hachette Premiere, Camera One, D D Productions, Rene Cleitman, Michel Seydoux and Jean-Paul Rappeneau
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Edmond Rostand, this lavish version of the classic French romance comedy combines the breathtaking wit and poetry of the play with the colour and spectacle of a good costume drama. Gerard Depardieu is perfect as the charismatic Cyrano, whose enormous nose makes him feel unworthy to love his cousin Roxanne (Anne Brochet). When Roxanne confesses her love for handsome young cadet Christian de Neuvillette (Vincent Perez), Cyrano becomes a reluctant conduit for his love when he becomes the ‘voice’ for the inarticulate Christian. Soon Roxanne has fallen in love with Christian’s handsome looks, but also with the passionate poetry of his soul, which she doesn’t realise is Cyrano. In French with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of 1991 Academy Award for Best Costume Design and 1991 Golden Globe for Best Foreign Film)
results.creator_credit_for_label: UGC Images, Hachette Premiere, Camera One, D D Productions, Rene Cleitman, Michel Seydoux and Jean-Paul Rappeneau

results.title: Cyclone warning
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Brian McDuffie
results.brief_description: A dramatization of the action a community needs to take to prepare for a cyclone in Northern Queensland. Centres on three teenagers, one whose father works on the cyclone warning section of the Bureau of Meteorology. Real life experts in cyclone warnings take part in a critique of the actors’ roles at the end of the film.

results.title: Cyclone Tracy
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read, Peter Johnson and Chris Noonan
results.brief_description: At Christmas 1974, Darwin was hit by Cyclone Tracy, which left a train of almost inconceivable destruction. This film shows the damage wrought, and people’s reactions during and after the cyclone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Timothy Read, Peter Johnson and Chris Noonan

results.title: Cyclone approaching
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: Indicates the counter-disaster operations initiated by the civil defence organizations and the simple safety procedures which should be followed by the community in general. Uses Cyclone Tracy as an example and includes graphic scenes depicting the type of devastation that cyclones can produce.

results.title: Cyclo = Xich lo
results.creator_credit: Lumière, Le Sept Cinema, La SFP Cinema, Cristophe Rossignon and Tran Anh Hung
results.brief_description: This film depicts the bustle and brutality of urban life in modern Saigon, a city overrun by crime, violence, sex and madness. An 18 year old boy, nicknamed ‘Cyclo’, is trying to scrape together a living in the desperate poverty of Saigon, whilst living with his two sisters and grandfather. When his pedi-cab is stolen he is forced into the criminal underworld in order to repay his debt. Initially taking on small errands for a small group of thugs, he soon becomes entangled in far more sinister events. In Vetnamese with English subtitles. Cast includes: Tran Nu Yen-Khe, Le Van Loc and Tony Leung Chiu-Wai. (Awards: Flanders, 1995 and Venice, 1995)

results.title: Cycling: still the greatest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet, Peter Katadotis and Gary Toole
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1976 Olympics and the 1978 Commonwealth Games capture all the thrills and excitement of cycling. Featured are some of the world’s best cyclists and their coaches, in training and in competition. This fast-growing sport is attracting the attention of cyclists and spectators alike.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet, Peter Katadotis and Gary Toole

results.title: Cyclic track maintenance
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways Board, Harry Hauptmann and Ted Davis
results.brief_description: This film displays the regular maintenance by Victorian Railways’ track engineers to keep tracks up to standard. Interesting sequences of the special machines and equipment in use, testing and re-laying train tracks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian Railways Board, Harry Hauptmann and Ted Davis

results.title: Cycle tour of Tasmania
results.brief_description: Captures the loneliness of the long distance cyclist. Covers one of the world’s most gruelling cycle races which circles the island. The aim of the film is to attract the premier amateur cycling countries to enter this event.

results.title: Cycle of progress
results.brief_description: Operations of the Alcoa Aluminium Company in Western Australia. The first bauxite mining operations commenced in 1963 at Jarrahdale, Western Australia. The bauxite is taken by rail to the refinery at Kwinana from where the alumina is shipped to the smelters at Point Henry, Victoria and to industry all over the world. The benefits to Australia as a whole from the establishment of one of the largest aluminium industries in the world are stated.
